Tao Yu

PhD student

Computer Science Department, Yale University

tao.[lastname]@yale.edu

Thanks for stopping by my website!

I am a 2nd-year PhD student in Computer Science at Yale University advised by Dragomir Radev. I am a member of LILY lab. I work in the area of Natural Language Processing. More specifically, my current research interest is to design and build a natural language interface to databases including automatically mapping users' questions to SQL queries for arbitrary database schemas.

Before coming to Yale, I completed my master's at Columbia University, where I worked on the BeST project for TAC KBP 2016 with Owen Rambow and Kathleen McKeown. Even before that, I was an undergraduate at the University of Utah.
